thread.title: Triathlete dies after water incident at Auckland pool
thread.title_full: Triathlete dies after water incident at Auckland pool

title: Triathlete dies after water incident at Auckland pool
text:
Triathlete dies after water incident at Auckland pool Last updated 12:52, February 10 2017 Chris McKeen/Fairfax NZ 
Emergency services responded to the incident at the Glen Innes Pool and Leisure Centre. 
A man training for a triathlon has died at an Auckland aquatic centre, police say. 
Emergency services responded to an incident in the east Auckland suburb of Glen Innes. 
The alarm was raised about 11am on Friday at the Glen Innes Pool and Leisure Centre. 
The man, who was in his 20s, was pulled from the water unresponsive and died a short time later, a police spokeswoman said. 
A witness said she understood the man was at the pool training for a triathlon. 
Three St John Ambulance crews responded to a "water incident", a St John spokeswoman said. 
A staff member at the centre refused to comment on the incident but said a statement would be issued later in the day. 
A man who was using the sauna at the time said he saw a young man lying at the side of the pool being tended to. 
The witness said the man looked very pale and was being treated with a defibrillator. 
Customers were told to leave the complex and the alarm sounded shortly after, he said. - Stuff
